data.title: Stop propagation on all commands in the editor
data.body: This is the real fix for #3075

data.title: Remove unnecessary params from Editor::getScrollWidth
data.body: The getScrollWidth function in editor.coffee has extra, unnecessary function parameters.

data.title: Autocomplete mini editor cursor position is off with React mini-editors
data.body: ![screenshot 2014-08-12 17 02 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/3899046/f6f9c252-2274-11e4-9677-93b6833dd148.png)

data.title: Add will-insert-event with cancel() function
data.body:
autocomplete and go-to-line both preempt the `textInput` event to prevent character insertion. 

This pull provides the editor with a `will-insert-text` event that passes a `cancel()` function as a param. The consumer can call `cancel()` when it wants to prevent the insertion. No more preempt!

This was originally in #3132, but was pulled out as it is necessary for proper mini-editor behavior. 

See atom/autocomplete#40 and atom/go-to-line#9 for package fixes.

Refs #3075

data.title: Remove number pad support
data.body:
This was confusing to people and a burden to package authors to have number pad keys behave differently than their equivalent key elsewhere on the keyboard.

See https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/42 for more details.

Closes #2527
Closes #2921
Closes #2972
Closes #3232

data.title: Remove opaque line background on mini editors
data.body:
The opaque backgrounds are unnecessary in the mini editors as they do not scroll and do not suffer from the same performance concerns. 

Some themes have transitions on mini-editor focus / blur, which is not being taken into account. Even focused / blureed state is not being taken into account (they seem to only sample the focused bg color). The easiest thing would be to remove this background for mini editors.

data.title: Pasting from Parallels VM results in bad line-endings?
data.body:
When pasting text from a Windows VM with Parallels into a new document, the document is saved with carriage-returns only.

I'm including screenshots of how Notepad++ shows the document for clarity as to what is showing up and what _should_ be showing up. Note that the screenshot used for the expected results is what I copied from the VM, and so has the Windows-style line-endings; I would be perfectly happy with the current Linux/OSX norm of `\n` instead.
#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new document in Atom
2. Copy text with line-breaks from anything in Windows VM
3. Paste into Atom
4. Save
#### Expected Results:

The resulting file contents should delimit line endings with either the line-feed character (ASCII 0x0A, `\n`, etc.) or a carriage-return character (ASCII 0x0D, `\r`, etc.) followed by a line-feed character.

![screen shot 2014-08-12 at 4 23 58 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1761309/3897190/8f5313a2-225f-11e4-8704-f32057d87ed8.png)
#### Actual Results:

The line endings in the resulting file contents are delimited by the carriage-return character.

![screen shot 2014-08-12 at 4 24 11 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1761309/3897235/fc009092-225f-11e4-8b19-dfedd499f484.png)

This of course causes git to show erroneous control characters in Terminal.app.

![screen shot 2014-08-12 at 4 24 53 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1761309/3897254/1dac6270-2260-11e4-8065-89c0c31b2a1b.png)
#### Extra Notes:
- The dev tools don't show any errors or warnings.
- Running `atom.workspace.getActiveEditor().getText().replace(/\r/g, '\\r').replace(/\n/g, '\\n')` in the console with an un-saved file returns `This\ris\ra\rtest\r`
- Pasting the same text into a new document with XCode results in a document using line-feed only
- I am currently observing this behavior in v0.120, but it is not new behavior

data.title: Namespace theme styles by adding a class to the body, revisited
data.body:
Why can't/shouldn't the main editor body get the theme name appended to it as a class? That way I can add my own changes to a theme in my styles.less file and have it only apply to that theme. If I change my theme, those changes might not make sense or even break other things in the new theme.
#701 was what I found when I searched but it didn't really seem to have a good reason for closing it.

data.title: Feature Request: Ctrl+arrow keys could jump within camelCased words.
data.body:
This is a super-useful feature that I miss from Sublime.

For example, given the filename `TopSecretAlgorithm.js`, with my cursor at the front of the word:

```
|TopSecretAlgorithm.js
```

I could press `ctrl+right` once to get over to `Secret`:

```
Top|SecretAlgorithm.js
```

again to get over to `Algorithm`:

```
TopSecret|Algorithm.js
```

Get it?  I would be happy to submit a PR if someone can point me in the right direction of where I should implement this.

data.title: Keybinding for switching tabs should work from anywhere.
data.body:
Is this change possible?

An example of something I can't do right now:
- `cmd+f` to search in the current file
- type something & search
- `cmd+shift+[` or `cmd+shift+]` to change tabs and search the same string in a different file.

Pressing `esc` gets me out of the "find" panel but that's not good enough.  Unless the "find" panel is using the same keybinding for something, maybe it could just fall through and let me change tabs?

Errors raised with handleWatcher

data.title: Added missing keymaps for num pad keys Home, End, PgUp, PgDown, Del and ...
data.body: Fix for issue #2921 and #2527

data.title: Saving read-only file causes Dev Tools to open
data.body:
Regardless if I press CTRL+S (which is mapped to core:save) or try to close a modified file and click save, the developer tools open... I can't save the file.....

Edit:
Turns out an error is thrown in the Console.
Uncaught Error: EPERM, operation not permitted '\UBUNTU\www\MYAPP\MYFILE.php'

data.title: Really kill buffered processes on windows
data.body:
Kills all the child processes of the buffered process on Windows.

Closes #3209

data.title: New API docs
data.body:
This moves away from biscotto and to generation of API doc json data.

Metadata JSON is generated by [donna](https://github.com/atom/donna), and then digested into something for easy html generation by [tello](https://github.com/atom/tello). The resulting JSON is committed here. I am not sure what exactly we want to do (likely just commit the tello.json).

This cannot be merged until we are ready to move away from the biscotto docs. This work has been started in https://github.com/github/atom.io/issues/638
### The Plan

I want to get the current API doc content out with a new docs site on atom.io. This should make the API changes much easier, as we can add things to the new docs site along with the API docs (eg. marking things essential + extended can all show up as public for a time). Here's how I think we should do it
### TODO
- [x] Convert all comments in core + packages to [atomdoc](https://github.com/atom/atomdoc) in this PR
  - [x] Atom
  - [x] BufferedNodeProcess
  - [x] BufferedProcess

  - [x] Config
  - [x] ContextMenuManager
  - [x] Cursor
  - [x] Decoration
  - [x] DeserializerManager

  - [x] Git
  - [x] Grammar
  - [x] GrammarRegistry
  - [x] KeymapManager
  - [x] Marker @benogle in text-buffer bo-atom-doc branch
  - [x] MenuManager
  - [x] PackageManager
  - [x] Pane
  - [x] PaneView
  - [x] Point
  - [x] Project
  - [x] Range
  - [x] ScrollView
  - [x] SelectListView
  - [x] Selection
  - [x] Syntax
  - [x] Task
  - [x] TextBuffer
  - [x] ThemeManager
  - [x] View
  - [x] Workspace
  - [x] WorkspaceView
- [x] Add generated `api.json` as a release asset @kevinsawicki
- [x] All external packages need newest grunt-atomdoc
- [ ] Generate docs from `api.json` on atom.io
- [x] Visual Changes
  - [x] Inline args
  - [x] :: instead of @, . for a class method, and gray it out maybe?
  - [x] move examples to be part of the description
  - [x] methods can have examples
  - [x] jump to sections
  - [x] Delineate sections a bit more / strengthen difference between categories
  - [x] just display the description, because the description will always contain the
     summary, or remove summary from description
  - [x] args can have children, e.g. callbacks that have arguments of their own
  - [x] The link to the class file should just use an icon

data.title: Can not compile atom with NodeJs v0.13
data.body:
Can not compile atom with NodeJs v0.13
Dependency not satisfied.

data.title: Enhancement: Allow scrolling past the end of the buffer
data.body: It would be nice to have a checkbox someplace that would allow the editor views to scroll past the end of the buffer, instead of having the last line being stuck at the bottom of the view.

data.title: Error: Cannot find module 'csslint'
data.body:
Loading "less-lint-task.js" tasks...ERROR

> > Error: Cannot find module 'csslint'

This happens after the "Deduping modules" step in script/build. I followed the instructions for building on GNU/Linux, with node 0.10.30 and npm 1.4.21. Installing some of the packages manually via npm worked, but there are still (apparently non-fatal) errors in the build log.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, unlink '/var/folders/...' fs.js:79
data.body:
Every time I switch to a certain buffer, the dev tools pop up with the following message.

```
Uncaught Error: ENOENT, unlink '/var/folders/hj/m94kg9kj703bjygh8r64jyrr0000gn/T/114711-30251-rsflbfsource.coffee' fs.js:79
```

The file name changes a bit each time, but there's no `source.coffee` in my project.

I removed a few plugins from atom recently. Could that be causing this?

data.title: cannot open atom from command line
data.body:
This command was working for me, then I set some permissions or something. How do I fix this?

```
$ atom .
usage: dirname path
Cannot locate Atom.app, it is usually located in /Applications. 
Set the ATOM_PATH environment variable to the directory containing Atom.app.
```

Running OSX

data.title: Save state during beforeunload event
data.body:
The window `unload` event is now async in Chrome 36, see #3144 for more details, so saving needs to be done during a `beforeunload` to ensure that on window reload the new render process is using the state saved from the previous render process.

This splits unload into two steps, the serializing/saving is done in a `beforeunload` while the workspace view and project are destroyed in the `unload` handler.

Fixes #3144

data.title: Leaking TokenizedBuffer when using React-based mini-editors in settings view
data.body: If you open the settings view multiple times and take heap snapshots in between, you'll notice the number of `TokenizedBuffer` instances climbing.

data.title: Atom cancels restart on Mac
data.body:
1. Select restart from Apple menu
2. If you have unsaved files Atom flat out cancels restart, vs. other apps behaviors of letting you save and then continue restart.

data.title: Install only for current user manual
data.body: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md could have a notice to explain how to install atom only for current user.

data.title: Update linux.md
data.body: Clarify the build steps. The most important is that initialy "Create ..." and "Install ..." could be interpreted as "(User should) create/install ..." while it should mean "(To) create/install ... (do)".

data.title: Move coffeelint settings to external file
data.body:
Depends on atom/grunt-coffeelint#2

The motivation is for this is to allow `coffeelint` config to be shared by
`script/grunt coffeelint`, global `coffeelint` and inline linting via
`AtomLinter`.

Test Plan:

Made some deliberate lint errors then ran `script/grunt coffeelint` and
verified the output looked the same with and without this change.

data.title: Pane background colour changes when tree view toggled
data.body:
Not sure why this happens or if it's indended, but seemed like it could be a bug. Notice that the background colour of the left pane changes when I toggle the tree view.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4427/3870833/b6864e50-20e1-11e4-86c4-684749197d7c.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4427/3870835/bc4e22c2-20e1-11e4-91ec-bf0fe96068f1.png)

data.title: Add API to remove menu items
data.body: I have an plugin that create a dynamic menu based on information on the filesystem (http://github.com/jhutchins/virtualenv) but I can't take that package to the next level without the ability to remove menu items. It's already gotten a little strange because I can add new items under certain conditions and they're just added to the end instead of in alphabetical order like the rest.
